page.title: 07Cresswell Railway Lines
page.content:
Today there are no railway stations in the area of study. At one time there was one at Cresswell on the main line which runs from Stoke to Derby and one at Totmonslow on a branch line from Cresswell to Cheadle.
This branch line is still in existance but B.R. say that it is disused, although occasional special trains do run to Cheadle with passengers for Alton Towers.
Field evidence does show that this line was re-routed at some time, as a disused tunnel can still be seen, close Draycott Cross. Discovery of this tunnel put us in mind of an Enid Blyton Famous Five story!
